sources.title: Articles on Smashing Magazine — For Web Designers And Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Scott Himmer)
articles.description: Product roadmaps are often treated as a series of checkboxes. But they are more than that. In this article, Scott Himmer explains how internal partnerships, research, design systems, and regular touch bases can help make sure that your product roadmap is a successful one.
articles.title: Changing A Tire On A Moving Car (Or How To Improve Product Roadmaps)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Luis Ouriach)
articles.description: In this article (the first part in a series of two), Luis Ouriach shares advice that he wishes he has when starting out in his career. These tips come from his experience as a user interface and product designer for close to ten years, and if you’re starting just now, then read on!
articles.title: Ten Tips For Aspiring Designer Beginners (Part 1)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Aleksandra Nagornaia)
articles.description: Figma has advanced enough where it now supports some powerful concepts that can help with the flexibility and maintainability of a design system. In this article, Sasha explains why she finds the Systems Designer position so rewarding — and it’s not only because of how fast certain tools have developed to help her master challenges she faces in her work projects.
articles.title: Composition-Based Design System In Figma

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: What better way could there be to start the new year than with some fresh inspiration? Our collection of wallpapers for January 2022 is bound to put a smile on your face — and maybe spark new ideas, too.
articles.title: New Year, Fresh Desktop (January 2022 Wallpapers Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Paul Boag)
articles.description: Scoping, estimating, and running digital projects can often feel like an exercise in futility. In this article, Paul Boag explains why you need to start breaking your projects down into manageable phases and why that’s the best way to achieve significant benefits.
articles.title: How To Price Projects And Manage Scope Creep

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Paulina Hetman)
articles.description: Have you already built and published a Gatsby theme? In this article, Paulina Hetman explains how Gatsby themes work and what problems they can solve by comparing Gatsby themes with their WordPress counterparts.
articles.title: Building Gatsby Themes For WordPress-Powered Websites

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Alyssa Holland)
articles.description: Range inputs have notoriously been a pain to style. Each browser renders the input differently requiring you to use vendor prefixes in order to create a cohesive look and feel. In this article, we’ll take a look at the quirkiness of the HTML range input and demonstrate how to style the input to look consistent across all major browsers.
articles.title: Creating A Custom Range Input That Looks Consistent Across All Browsers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: A meaningful user experience is what can set your site apart from others. But what makes an experience truly meaningful? And how to achieve that? The tools, tips, and resources in this post not only help you to come up with a UX strategy that works for you and your team but also to circumvent potential UX pitfalls.
articles.title: Useful UX Guidelines, Tools And Resources

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Barry Pollard)
articles.description: How to improve Core Web Vitals, a Smashing Magazine case study on how we detected and fixed the bottlenecks, and how we ended up with green scores, all the way.
articles.title: Improving Core Web Vitals, A Smashing Magazine Case Study

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Nick Babich & Gleb Kuznetsov)
articles.description: Modern HMIs are transforming the way we interact with our vehicles. A car becomes a gadget that we use in a similar way as we use our phones. Users expect a lot of HMI, they even evaluate car experience based on the experience they have with HMI. In this article, let’s look at some ways to help us satisfy users’ needs with proper design.
articles.title: Designing Human-Machine Interfaces For Vehicles Of The Future

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Nwani Victory)
articles.description: In every software-as-a-service solution, user billing and payments are key aspects in the sale of services rendered. Let’s learn about Stripe and how the REST API can be programmatically used in serverless functions to manage the billing for an application.
articles.title: Billing Management For Your Next SaaS Idea Using Stripe And Azure Functions

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Steven Hoober)
articles.description: Before we can talk about how people interact, much less how to take advantage of that knowledge and design, it’s important to understand a bit about the history, the technology, and what today counts as a mobile touchscreen device at all.
articles.title: Touch Design For Mobile Interfaces: Defining Mobile Devices (Excerpt)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Nafees Nehar)
articles.description: To be able to modify headers in a testing environment is a great thing to have. It allows control over your application as one can bypass authentication, set cookies, and so on. In this article, Nafees Nehar explores some methods which allow modification of headers in an automation testing setup.
articles.title: Modifying Headers In HTTP(s) Requests In UI Automation Testing

articles.description: In this post we're going to get all the headings from a freeCodeCamp blog post to make a Table of Contents (ToC) in Ghost CMS. I recently published quite a large post here on freeCodeCamp and needed to add a table of contents to the post. There's a really good
articles.title: How to Get Headings and IDs for Your freeCodeCamp Blog Post Table of Contents

articles.description: Have you ever sat down to write some code or browse the internet, only to discover that your keyboard isn't working?  When your keyboard fails to work, it could be due to:  Physical damage Dirt Filter keys Outdated or corrupt driver Low battery (if you're using an external keyboard). You
articles.title: Keyboard Not Working? How to Fix Windows 10 Keyboard Not Typing Problem

articles.description: When you're learning the basics of most programming languages, you are bound to come across operators.  In this tutorial, we will talk about the not equal operator in Python and also see a few examples of how it works.  Operators and Operands in PythonBefore talking about the not equal operator,
articles.title: Python Not Equal – Does Not Equal Operator Tutorial

articles.description: In this tutorial, you will learn how to work in a team with a central repository on GitHub. You will work on issues, commits, pull requests, code reviews, and more. I don't consider myself an expert on Git, but I have learned a lot about it in my first month
articles.title: How to Use Git and GitHub in a Team like a Pro – Featuring Harry and Hermione 🧙

articles.description: In this article, you'll learn about the .append() method in Python.  You'll also see how .append() differs from other methods used to add elements to lists.  Let's get started!  What are lists in Python? A definition for beginners An array in programming is an ordered collection of items, and all
articles.title: Append in Python – How to Append to a List or an Array

articles.description: On Windows 10 and other versions of the Windows operating system, you need a network adapter to connect to the internet through a wired or wireless network.  Sometimes, you might get an error that your network adapter is missing. This can be very frustrating because you won't be able to
articles.title: Windows 10 Network Adapter Missing – How to Install Ethernet Driver on PC

articles.description: Pie charts are common components that let you show portions of a whole, and you can use them for many different purposes.  You will find a lot of articles around building such a component, but they typically either rely on SVG or a lot of HTML elements.  In this post,
articles.title: How to Create a Pie Chart Using Only CSS

articles.description: Two years out of coding bootcamp and I had an incredible offer from one of the world’s most highly-regarded tech companies…and I declined it. On paper, it was the dream job. Heck, it would have been the most “adult” job I’d ever had in my life so
articles.title: Why I Turned Down a Six-Figure Salary in Big Tech to Stay at a Five-Person Startup

articles.description: To improve your skills in machine learning and artificial intelligence, it is important to solve real-world problems. What better problem to solve then helping to save people's lives? Machine learning is being used more and more in the field of healthcare. PyTorch and Monai can be used to discover tumors
articles.title: Real-World Machine Learning—PyTorch and Monai for Healthcare Imaging

articles.description: Material UI's Data Grid is a powerful and flexible data table. It makes it easy for you to display data and perform out of the box functionalities such as editing, sorting, filtering, pagination and more. In this article, we'll discuss why you should use the Data Grid in Material UI
articles.title: How to Integrate the Material UI Data Grid in React Using Data from a REST API
